Functions

on_ctcp_ping

sub on_ctcp_ping

Event callback called by POE when a CTCP PING is recieved.

Responds to the sender with a PING-reply

Do not call this manually

Params

none (POE event call)

Returns

1

on_ctcpreply_ping

sub on_ctcpreply_ping

Event callback called by POE when a CTCP PING reply is recieved.

If a timestampt is supplied, we assume that we sent it along with a CTCP PING and calculate the difference between current time and the timestamp

Do not call this manually

Params

none (POE event call)

Returns

1

on_ctcp_version

sub on_ctcp_version

Event callback called by POE when a CTCP VERSION is recieved.

Responds to the sender with version information Anna::Utils::SCRIPT_NAME, Anna::Utils::SCRIPT_VERSION & Anna::Utils::SCRIPT_SYSTEM

Do not call this manually

Params

none (POE event call)

Returns

1

on_ctcpreply_version

sub on_ctcpreply_version

Event callback called by POE when a CTCP VERSION reply is recieved.

Prints the version information and hums along.

Do not call this manually

Params

none (POE event call)

Returns

1

on_ctcp_time

sub on_ctcp_time

Event callback called by POE when a CTCP TIME is recieved.

Sends a CTCP response with the current system time.  RFC permits arbitrary formats so we use scalar localtime time

Do not call this manually

Params

none (POE event call)

Returns

1

on_ctcp_finger

sub on_ctcp_finger

Technically supposed to be a finger-implementation but that’s boring, so respond with a rude remark instead.

Event callback called by POE when a CTCP FINGER is recieved.

Do not call this manually

Params

none (POE event call)

Returns

1
